ygData.subject: Re: Phobia is now a free agent
ygData.msgSnippet: If your logic circuits were damaged then how do you know that the path you follow is the logical one? You have left a base that has about a dozen or so cons
ygData.rawEmail:
Return-Path: <cyberwolf4@...>
Received: (qmail 19788 invoked from network); 5 Jul 2000 18:01:52 -0000
Received: from unknown (10.1.10.142) by m2.onelist.org with QMQP; 5 Jul 2000 18:01:52 -0000
Received: from unknown (HELO hm.egroups.com) (10.1.10.45) by mta1 with SMTP; 5 Jul 2000 18:01:52 -0000
X-eGroups-Return: cyberwolf4@...
Received: from [10.1.10.102] by hm.egroups.com with NNFMP; 05 Jul 2000 18:01:50 -0000
Date: Wed, 05 Jul 2000 18:00:56 -0000
To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
Subject: Re: Phobia is now a free agent
Message-ID: <8jvt4o+5507@...>
In-Reply-To: <20000705160330.9308.qmail@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 13862
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: cyberwolf4@...

"If your logic circuits were damaged then how do you know that the 
path you follow is the logical one?"

"You have left a base that has about a dozen or so cons to keep you 
from being scrapped. A base that could easily hold it's own against 
any enemy. Why? because you think a lone spider in a transport ship 
with low level pulse cannons can win a war? My friend, you're logic 
circuits must be fried."

Phobia was pushing Pantrons buttons, he needed to know just how 
commited he was to survival. He needed to know if this was loyalty or 
just a temporary home. He wanted to know that if they got into a 
firefight, would they die together or would Pantron run away at the 
first sign of defeat? Destrons and Predicons had very similar 
circuitry, so deep down Pantron had to be the same greedy, arrogant, 
powerhungry, creature that they all were. Within himself Phobia knew 
this was true about himself as well.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, ddsg sdgfd <earth2025abc@y...> wrote:
> 
>  
> My reason for risking deliation. Well there is only one reason. I 
was made to serve magmatron.(stated in first arrival.) But when i 
landed my circutry was damaged. Messing with my logic circuts. It 
made me question everything since I arrived. So now Im trying to find 
who I belive is the one who will be able to win this war. And I know 
whoever that is. You will be on that side. That in my book is worthy 
enough to risk deliation.(You can have your guns, they just have to 
remain deactivated, 
> activate them and you're history. Past, present, and future, these 
> temporal things are confusing.)
> 
> "What are your goals Pantron? I know why I'm here, what's your 
> reason? You picked now to abandon the only leader you have on this 
> planet,. You must have a reason for existence." Phobia's studied 
> cybertrons past, he knows enough about the great war to get by. He 
> studies Pantron, thinking of all the defectors in the past, 
> Starscream, Foxfingers, Darvolt, all betrayed thier leaders, just 
to 
> end up as particles splattered on the side of an asteroid 
somewhere. 
> So why was Pantron willing to risk deleation?
> 
> (Starscream was destroyed by Galvatron, Foxfingers stole an 
artifact 
> from the Autobots and was killed by an older model of Shockwave.
> (Another RPG I was involved with, and Darvolt pledged allegiance to 
> Unicron. Niether side took kindly to that. Again another RPG)
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, ddsg sdgfd <earth2025abc@y...> wrote:
> > 
> >  
> > 
> > Pantron thought over the question. I guess I came because I 
needed 
> to. Im a destron. I had served under magmatron for a VERY long 
time. 
> But he has grown ignorant in his age. He doesnt see the big 
picture. 
> So now im trying to find the onbe person who has the same goals as 
i 
> do. I belive that to be you. After that pantron thought of his own 
> question. Can I pick up my guns. Still offline?Phobia smiled a sly 
> smile. He knew Pantron,s life was in his hands. 
> > Scanners showed Pantrons weapons were still offlin, and with the 
> ship 
> > set for his voice commands, there wasn't anything Pantron could 
do 
> to 
> > doublecross the spider. External scans showed no sign of 
> transformer 
> > life so he figured the Predicons weren't interested in him or his 
> > new "friend".
> > 
> > "So Pantron, what brings you to this side of the universe?"
> > 
> > Phobia suspected that the Ark was a big reason for all the 
activity 
> > on this planet, but he somehow knew there was more. All he had to 
> do 
> > was find out just how much more.
> > 
> > He set the ships controls for a high orbit to avoid any 
planetside 
> > sensors, and kept to the sunny side of Earth so sunspot activity 
> > might hide any approaching ships. Three ships have arrived since 
he 
> > got there, he didn't want to take the chance of a forth.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, ddsg sdgfd <earth2025abc@y...> wrote:
> > > 
> > >  
> > > 
> > >  Pantron watched as the ship landed. He walked aboard and 
> prepared 
> > to meet phobia cyberwolf4@p... wrote: 
> > > Phobias eyes lit up after hearing what Pantron had just told 
him. 
> > He 
> > > doubted the information about the key, but the mention of the 
Ark 
> > > confirmed his suspicions. He was on Earth, the damn planet that 
> got 
> > > the origional Megatron killed. (transformers the Movie Megatron 
> was 
> > > wounded in the Earth battle, and later thrown into space by 
> > > Starscream.) Phobia knew of the great war , not being 
programmed 
> as 
> > a 
> > > historian, he never bothered to download all the datatracks.
> > > 
> > > Phobia almost admired Pantron. Pantron was unarmed and 
> defenseless, 
> > > saying all the right things to stay alive. He could tell a 
> survivor 
> > > when he saw one, and right now Pantron was despeate enough to 
> side 
> > > with Phobia to stay that way.
> > > 
> > > "Computer, set all controls to my voice, lock on to my vitals. 
If 
> > my 
> > > vitals drop, land on top of the nearest translifeform and 
> detonate."
> > > 
> > > Phobia didn't trust anyone except himself, and even that was a 
> thin 
> > > trust.
> > > 
> > > "I'm landing Pantron prepare to come aboard."
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, ddsg sdgfd <earth2025abc@y...> wrote:
> > > > 
> > > >  
> > > > 
> > > > Pantron was already in beast mode. He took out his weapons 
and 
> > > disarmed them. He was takeing a very large chance here. The bot 
> > could 
> > > destroy him at any time. " I have information you want. I have 
> been 
> > > around for a long time. I was around when Rodimus Prime was 
> > crowned. 
> > > You need me but I need you more. Also I have a key to the ark. 
It 
> > > will give us the power to fly it if we ever get a hold of the 
> ark. 
> > It 
> > > was given to me by a friend. He stole it when he helped 
megatron 
> > > steal the golden discs. Please let us talk."Pantron heard the 
> > > rumbling of engines above him. He turned to see 
> > > > Phobias ship lowering itself towards the ground.
> > > > 
> > > > Phobia wasn,t sure if the other Predicons had gotten his 
> message, 
> > > he 
> > > > figured Pantron had information that the Predicon army would 
> > want. 
> > > If 
> > > > they weren't interested then he certainly was. In war it 
isn't 
> > who 
> > > > has the most firepower, it was who has the most detailed 
> > > information.
> > > > 
> > > > The ooutside intercom opened, and with a booming resonance 
> > Phobias 
> > > > voice came alive. "Pantron, transform to your beast mode (If 
he 
> > > > already isn't) and step forward. You are being scanned, 
disarm 
> > your 
> > > > weapons and we'll talk. Until then I will consider you as big 
a 
> > > > threat as Magmatron. I think you know what I'd do to him in 
> this 
> > > > situation, don't you." Phobia knew either way he held an 
> > unbeatable 
> > > > hand.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, ddsg sdgfd <earth2025abc@y...> 
wrote:
> > > > > 
> > > > >  
> > > > > Pantron got the message from phobia. He locked on to the

would 
> be 
> > > > waiting for him.

> > > > > Phobia knew about Pantron, he'd heard enough to know that 
> > neither 
> > > > one 
> > > > > of them could step anywhere within 100 miles of Magmatrons 
> base 
> > > > > without a eulogy handy. Phobia had deceived and swindled 
the 
> > > > > Destrucon leader and he knew one day he'd have slag to pay. 
> > > Unless 
> > > > he 
> > > > > had a scape goat, or at least a scape panther to take the 
> blow 
> > > for 
> > > > > him. On this planet he needed all the shields he could find.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Phobia to Pantor, if you're familiar with the Destrucon map 
> of 
> > > this 
> > > > > planet meet me at coordinates 9211-8 (What will one day be

> > > > > Japan.) If youcan arrange transportation. Keep radio 
silence

> > > > > group of Predicons he'd detected near the Arks location. 
With

> > > > > (Megatron, Hellbeast, this means you.)
> > > > >

> wrote:
> > > > > > Pohbia i wish to join you. This is Pantron. Pleae
> > > > > > accept for i have no other place to go
> > > > > > --- cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > > > > > Phobia set his position on the moon, and coagulated
> > > > > > > what limited 
> > > > > > > information he'd "Borrowed" from Magmatrons
> > > > > > > computers, with his 
> > > > > > > origional scans. Now that he'd added some

> > > > > > > with his systems there was a good chance that he
> > > > > > > wouldn't be blown

> > > > > > >

> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > His babies that he left behind conyinued to relay
> > > > > > > information to him 
> > > > > > > on a regular basis so he knew that Magmatrons guests
> > > > > > > turned down his 
> > > > > > > invatation. That would mean that Magmatron would be
> > > > > > > really pissed off 
> > > > > > > when he realized Phobia didn't plan on returning.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > He continues scanning the planet to find active
> > > > > > > Predicon signatures.
> > > > > > >
